alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches; Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued November 15 at 10:24AM PST until November 16 at 2:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT INTO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents, breaking waves, and minor coastal flooding due to elevated surf through late tonight especially for south-facing beaches of Ventura, Santa Barbara, and San Luis Obispo Counties. Areas of lightning at the beaches possible for Los Angeles County through this afternoon. * WHERE...The beaches of southern California. * WHEN...Through the late night hours. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. Some water on low lying roads and property. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Cloud-to-ground lightning may occur for the Los Angeles County beaches, which could cause serious injury or death.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions and lightning. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
